body:
Hello,

Could you tell me how to set up a Spack smoke test (or stand-alone) for a header-only library?

I'm trying to implement a smoke test in the [Metall package](https://github.com/spack/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/metall/package.py) (founded by the Exascale Computing Project).

I read [this](https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packaging_guide.html#stand-alone-or-smoke-tests) section on Spack's Read the Docs, but I have some questions.

**Executables:**
As Metall is a C++ header-only library, we don't generate any executables during the installation unless users turn on the build-test option (Metall already supports a Spack build-time test).

I found a sentence that says `run_test` method builds executable. But, I don't quite understand how to use it to build an executable:
https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/packaging_guide.html#reading-expected-output-from-a-file

**Compiler:**
Is it possible to install a proper version of a compiler before running a smoke test?

Thank you,
Keita
title: Implement Smoke Test (or stand-alone) for a Header-only Library
